alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Wayne County through 815 PM EDT... At 730 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jesup, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Jesup, Screven, Odum, Doctortown and Broadhurst. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
